title: Ecto-token

properties.value: Ecto-tokens are the currency of Port Phasmatys. They have several uses in and around the city, and can be used to charge a bonecrusher. Players may obtain them by offering to the Ectofuntus.

Ecto-tokens are the currency of Port Phasmatys. They have several uses in and around the city, and can be used to charge a bonecrusher. Players may obtain them by offering to the Ectofuntus.

Contents

  • 1 Obtaining Ecto-tokens
  • 2 Uses
  • 3 Changes
  • 4 Gallery

Obtaining Ecto-tokens[edit | edit source]

Main article: Ectofuntus

Ecto-tokens can be earned by worshipping the Ectofuntus, granting 5 tokens and a certain amount of Prayer experience per worship. Players need any type of bones, a pot and a bucket of slime to complete the ritual, with one of each required for every offering. The bones and slime will be consumed, leaving you with the empty bucket and empty pot. This will grant four times the usual Prayer experience. Speaking with a ghost disciple while wearing a ghostspeak amulet or Morytania legs 2+ allows the player to claim the tokens.

Uses[edit | edit source]

Before completing the Ghosts Ahoy quest, players need to pay a toll of 2 ecto-tokens whenever they want to enter the fallen city Port Phasmatys. However, this toll can be ignored by chartering a ship to the city instead. After the quest, no more toll has to be paid.

Ecto-tokens are always required for two quests:

  • Between 25 and 31 tokens for Ghosts Ahoy, depending on how you enter the city.
  • 20 tokens for Animal Magnetism.

They also have several more uses:

  • Purchasing ale yeast from Metarialus for 5 tokens. However, this may also be bought from Blandebir for only 25 coins.
  • Purchasing an undead chicken from Alice's husband after the Animal Magnetism quest for 10 tokens.
  • Travelling to Dragontooth Island costs 25 tokens, reduced to 10 while wearing the ring of charos (a). You may also give the ghost captain 500 tokens for permanently free trips to the island. The island has no uses after the Ghosts Ahoy quest, other than being part of certain elite and master clue scrolls.
  • Charging the Bonecrusher and Bonecrusher necklace for 25 charges per token used. This tool is a reward from the hard Morytania Diary and, when charged, buries bones of slain enemies instantly.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
13 July 2017
(update | poll)

The Ectofuntus can be used until there are 1000 ecto-tokens held by the Ghost disciples.

24 September 2015
(update)

The ecto-token limit at the Ectofuntus has been raised to 65, allowing 13 bones to be offered in a single inventory.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

Ecto-tokens can now be used on the Bonecrusher to give it 25 charges per token if you have completed the Morytania Hard Diary.

4 October 2005 –
7 February 2006

The item's examine was changed from "A token with ectoplasm on." to "A token with ectoplasm on it."

They have several uses in and around the city, and can be used to charge a [[bonecrusher]]. Players may obtain them by offering to the [[Ectofuntus]]. == Obtaining Ecto-tokens == {{Main|Ectofuntus}} Ecto-tokens can be earned by worshipping the [[Ectofuntus]], granting 5 tokens and a certain amount of [[Prayer]] experience per worship. Players need any type of [[bones]], a [[pot]] and a [[bucket of slime]] to complete the ritual, with one of each required for every offering. The bones and slime will be consumed, leaving you with the empty bucket and empty pot. This will grant '''four times''' the usual Prayer experience. Speaking with a [[ghost disciple]] while wearing a [[ghostspeak amulet]] or [[Morytania legs]] 2+ allows the player to claim the tokens. ==Uses== Before completing the [[Ghosts Ahoy]] quest, players need to pay a toll of 2 ecto-tokens whenever they want to enter the fallen city [[Port Phasmatys]]. However, this toll can be ignored by [[Charter ship|chartering a ship]] to the city instead. After the quest, no more toll has to be paid. Ecto-tokens are always required for two quests: * Between 25 and 31 tokens for [[Ghosts Ahoy]], depending on how you enter the city. * 20 tokens for [[Animal Magnetism]]. They also have several more uses: * Purchasing [[ale yeast]] from [[Metarialus]] for 5 tokens. However, this may also be bought from [[Blandebir]] for only 25 [[coins]]. * Purchasing an [[Undead chicken (item)|undead chicken]] from [[Alice's husband]] after the [[Animal Magnetism]] quest for 10 tokens. * Travelling to [[Dragontooth Island]] costs 25 tokens, reduced to 10 while wearing the [[ring of charos (a)]]. You may also give the [[ghost captain]] 500 tokens for permanently free trips to the island. The island has no uses after the [[Ghosts Ahoy]] quest, other than being part of certain [[Clue scroll (elite)|elite]] and [[Clue scroll (master)|master clue scrolls]]. * Charging the [[Bonecrusher]] and [[Bonecrusher necklace]] for 25 charges per token used. This tool is a reward from the [[Morytania Diary#Hard|hard Morytania Diary]] and, when charged, buries bones of slain enemies instantly. ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 13 July 2017 |update = Lizardman Shaman Improvements |poll = Old School Content Poll 54: Binding spells, F2P Castle Wars, etc. |change = The Ectofuntus can be used until there are 1000 ecto-tokens held by the Ghost disciples. }} {{Subject changes |date = 24 September 2015 |update = New Animations & Barbarian Assault Changes |change = The ecto-token limit at the Ectofuntus has been raised to 65, allowing 13 bones to be offered in a single inventory. }} {{Subject changes |date = 5 March 2015 |update = Achievement Diaries |poll = Old School Achievement Diary Rewards Poll |change = Ecto-tokens can now be used on the [[Bonecrusher]] to give it 25 charges per token if you have completed the [[Morytania Hard Diary]]. }} {{Subject changes |daterange = 4 October 2005 –
7 February 2006 |change = The item's examine was changed from "A token with ectoplasm on." to "A token with ectoplasm on it." }} {{Subject changes footer}} ==Gallery== Ecto-token 1 detail.png|One ecto-token Ecto-token 2 detail.png|Two ecto-tokens Ecto-token detail.png|Three ecto-tokens {{Ghosts Ahoy}} {{Currencies}}
